comments: As a Molien series this arises as (1+x^12)/((1-x^4)*(1-x^8)^2).1.1 on p.3 of Strapasson gives a graph theory use about circulant graphs of genus 1 of the formula a(n) = ceiling(n^2/4). The subsequence of primes in this sequence begins: 3, 7, 13, 31, 43, 73, 157, 211, 241, 307, 421, 463, 601, 757, 1123, 1483. [_Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 05 2010]Starting (1, 3, 4,...) = row sums of an infinite triangle with alternate columns of (1, 2, 3,...) and (1, 0, 0, 0,...). [_Gary W. Adamson_, May 14 2010]A000290 and A002061 (but without the first term of A002061) interleaved. - _Omar E. Pol_, Sep 28 2011
